meanings.definition: To weep more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always outweeps her friends when watching sad movies.
meanings.sent2: He outweeps his siblings whenever he gets a small injury.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outweeps her teddy bear when she can't find it.
meanings.sent4: Her heart outweeps the rain pouring down outside.
meanings.sent5: The old tree outweeps the young sapling in the forest.

meanings.sent1: The baby outweeps everyone in the room with his loud cries.
meanings.sent2: She outweeps all her classmates when she hears sad news.
meanings.sent3: The puppy outweeps its owner when it's time for a bath.
meanings.sent4: His sorrow outweeps the river flowing by his house.
meanings.sent5: The storm outweeps the clouds as it rages across the sky.
